title: 'Nationwide Health Emergency': Plea Filed In Top Court Over Air Pollution
content: A public interest litigation (PIL) has been filed before the Supreme Court seeking urgent judicial intervention in the "nationwide public health emergency" caused by escalating air pollution across India.

title: Toxic Chemical Found In Fake Labubu Dolls In Sweden, Steps To Verify Yours
content: Counterfeit Labubu dolls being sold in Sweden have been found to contain dangerously high levels of the plastic-softening chemical DEPH, according to the Swedish Chemicals Agency.

title: Bihar Assembly Elections Phase 1 2025 Live Updates: 60% Turnout Recorded Till 5 pm
content: The first phase of the Bihar assembly polls saw several senior political figures cast their votes early on Thursday. Among the early voters were RJD leader and INDIA bloc Chief Minister candidate Tejashwi Yadav

title: Mamata Banerjee Livid After Trinamool Mouthpiece Reports She Filled SIR Form
content: Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, embarrassed after a report in her party mouthpiece that she had filled in a form for the ongoing voter list revision exercise, has issued a flat denial.

title: Bihar Sees 60% Turnout Till 5 pm, Already Higher Than Phase 1 In 2020
content: The high-profile battle for Bihar has begun, with half the state's 243 seats voting today in the first of the two-phase election. Led by Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, the ruling NDA is hoping for yet another term in the state.

title: “Get The Kids, Get Security”: Erika Kirk Relives Day Charlie Kirk Was Shot
content: For Turning Point USA CEO Erika Kirk, the moment she discovered her husband Charlie Kirk had been shot was, in her words, an "unbelievable nightmare."

title: What Is Vreels, New Social Media Platform Made By India And The US
content: In a world where people juggle multiple apps to create content, chat, and shop, Vreels brings everything together in one space.

title: Man Declared 'Dead', Buried By Family, Returns Alive A Week Later
content: The family of Purushottam, a resident of neighbouring Chanderpur village, approached the police as he had been missing for two days. Upon seeing the body, they "identified" the dead man as Purushottam.

title: US To Host 5 Central Asian Nations Amid Battle For Region's Mineral Resources
content: US President Donald Trump will host the leaders of five Central Asian nations at the White House on Thursday as the US seeks to gain influence in a region long dominated by Russia and increasingly courted by China.

title: Video: Man Gropes Mexican President, Tries To Kiss Her As She Speaks To People
content: In a disturbing video that has now gone viral on the internet, a man groped Claudia Sheinbaum, the President of Mexico, and even tried to kiss her before a member of the presidential security intervened.

title: Karnataka High Court Dismisses State Appeal Against Public Area Gatherings
content: In a setback to the Congress-led government in Karnataka, the Dharwad bench of Karnataka High Court on Thursday dismissed the state's appeal petition over its order mandating permission for private organisations to hold activities in public areas.

title: "He Should Be Ashamed": Amit Shah On Rahul Gandhi's Army Caste Remark
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi should be ashamed for seeking to know about the caste and religion of Army jawans.

title: FIR Against Unidentified Person In Bilaspur Train Crash That Killed 11
content: In the wake of the tragic train accident in Bilaspur district of Chhattisgarh, police have registered an FIR (first information report) against an unidentified individual, marking the beginning of a formal criminal investigation.

title: India, US Discuss Bilateral Trade Engagement, Signing of 10-year Defence Deal
content: India's Ambassador to the US, Vinay Mohan Kwatra, met US Senator Steve Daines and discussed current bilateral trade engagement, signing of the 10-year defence framework agreement and opportunities for collaboration in technology.

title: No Bridge, Locals In This Bihar Town Use Boats To Reach Polling Booths
content: As voting is underway for the first phase of assembly polls in Bihar, locals of the Danapur Diara in the Patna district used boats to reach the polling stations and cast their votes for the first phase of the Bihar elections.

title: In Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills, A Bypoll Has Turned Into Full-Fledged War
content: The summer has gone by, but the political temperature in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills constituency has soared.

title: 24-Year-Old Arrested After Man Dies In Hit-And-Run Case In Delhi
content: A 35-year-old man was killed in a hit-and-run incident in central Delhi, and the accused in the case has been arrested, police said on Thursday.

title: Stalker Who Shot Class 12 Student Twice Arrested, Shot In Leg By Police
content: The stalker who shot a 17-year-old girl in Faridabad after she spurned his advances has been arrested and has suffered a bullet injury in his leg in an encounter with police

title: 'RJD, Congress Have Soft Corner For Infiltrators': PM Modi In Bihar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday charged the opposition RJD-Congress combine in Bihar with having a soft corner for infiltrators, but "dislike" for Lord Ram and 'Chhathi Maiya' because of vote bank politics.

title: On Camera, Girl Returning From Coaching Shot Twice By Stalker In Faridabad
content: In a chilling stalker attack, a man opened fire on a 17-year-old girl at Ballabhgarh in Haryana's Faridabad district, about 40 km from the Delhi border. The teenager has been hospitalised, and police are looking for the shooter.

title: Massive fire heavily damages Spoelstra's home
content: The home of Miami Heat coach Erik Spoelstra was heavily damaged by a massive fire Thursday morning. There were no immediate reports of injuries.

title: Ex-NU coach Fitzgerald 'vindicated' by settlement
content: Former Northwestern coach Pat Fitzgerald addressed his settlement with the coach and told ESPN's "College GameDay" podcast that he is actively seeking a return to the college sideline.

title: Binnington tries to hide puck from Ovi's 900th goal
content: Blues goaltender Jordan Binnington was seen tucking away the puck from Alex Ovechkin's 900th goal into the back of his pants, before he eventually handed it over to a linesman.

title: KAT 'still stunned' by trade as Knicks rout Wolves
content: Karl-Anthony Towns said after Wednesday's game that a year later, it's still "weird" to face his former teammates.

title: ESPN names DraftKings official odds provider
content: In a deal starting Dec. 1, ESPN has named DraftKings its Official Sportsbook and Odds Provider, it was announced Thursday.

title: Westbrook fuels Kings, makes rebounding history
content: Russell Westbrook used the 204th triple-double of his career to deliver a win for Sacramento, meanwhile passing Jason Kidd for the most career rebounds by an NBA guard.

title: Wembanyama stalled out again in loss to Lakers
content: Victor Wembanyama says adjustments are needed after a second straight game of double-teams ended in a 118-116 Spurs loss to the Lakers.

title: Pochettino 'missing' PL, eyes return after USMNT
content: United States men's national team coach Mauricio Pochettino has admitted that he is "missing" the Premier League and plans to return to return to England.

title: NFL midseason report: Every team from every angle, plus keys to the second half
content: The 2025 season has hit the midway point, and we have things to watch in the second half, key QB stats and fantasy nuggets for all 32 teams.

title: Barnwell's midseason awards: Ranking candidates for MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Which QBs are in the MVP mix? Let's pick three front-runners for seven NFL awards through nine weeks.

title: Your guide to MLB free agency: Rankings and contract projections for the top 50 free agents
content: How much will the biggest stars get paid this winter? Kiley McDaniel breaks down the 2025-26 free agent class.

title: Offseason rumors and buzz: What we're hearing as free agency begins
content: Will Tarik Skubal be dealt? Who could sign Kyle Schwarber and Kyle Tucker? The hot stove is ready to ignite.

title: Ja Morant and the Grizzlies: Everything we know about the latest drama in Memphis
content: Where do things stand between Memphis and its star guard? NBA insiders break down how we got here, and what could come next.

title: Lindsey Harding, an incredible journey to the Lakers' bench and an unprecedented next step
content: She was the No. 1 pick in the 2007 WNBA draft. She has played all over the world and coached through triumph and horror. Now, Harding is not only a leading voice for JJ Redick, LeBron and the Lakers, but is on the short list for future NBA head coaches.

title: Ranking the power conferences to open 2025-26
content: Which league will produce the 2026 national champion? We're tracking the power conferences on the road to the Final Four.

title: Five key questions that will shape the 2026 women's NCAA bracket
content: The SEC race and Big Ten's nonconference performance could have the biggest impact on the women's NCAA bracket.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: Matchups, preview, how to watch Penguins-Capitals on ESPN+
content: How many more times will we see Crosby vs. Ovechkin? Here are the  stats to know, broadcast details and more.

title: 'He's the best pass rusher': How Nik Bonitto's first step has helped him become an NFL star
content: Bonitto's ability to explode into his pass rush has made him a leader of the Broncos' great defense -- and a Defensive Player of the Year candidate.

title: Jayden Daniels' injury echoes past Commanders mistakes, raises larger NFL questions
content: The Commanders QB is one of the league's best young players -- and its most-hit over the past two years.

title: How Clayton Kershaw's legacy will live on with Dodgers
content: The future Hall of Famer has hung up his spikes, but as L.A.'s dynasty continues, so will his influence.

title: Is the Champions League Arsenal's to lose? Ranking the field, Best XI at midway point
content: We're halfway through the league phase of the UEFA Champions League! Which teams are thriving and which teams are struggling? Bill Connelly offers his stock watch, best XI and power rankings so far.

title: Dynamic and dangerous vs. Dortmund, Foden must be part of England's World Cup squad
content: England coach Thomas Tuchel knows how good Phil Foden is. But Foden's Champions League brace was a timely reminder of his immense talent.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Most impactful newcomers on all 30 teams
content: NBA insiders break down the most impactful player, rookie or coach and where all 30 teams stack up in this week's power rankings.

title: Who's the striker beating Mbappé, Haaland in race for European Golden Shoe?
content: Who has been the most lethal forward in Europe this season? Kylian Mbappé? Erling Haaland? No, it's little-known striker in the Latvian league.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Spurs star Van de Ven
content: Real Madrid hold a "genuine interest" in Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Graziano & Fowler: What we're hearing on the Jets, Cowboys, Dolphins, Seahawks and more
content: What's the fallout from the Jets' blockbuster trades? What about other moves that did or did not happen around the league? We have the latest.

title: Winners, losers of a wild trade deadline: Solak weighs in on Jets, Cowboys and Jakobi Meyers
content: Well, things escalated quickly. Which teams made the best -- and worst -- moves before the trade deadline?

title: Trade, pick up or hold? What to do with these four hot fantasy QBs
content: Not all good fantasy QBs do damage with their legs. We highlight four pocket passers who are thriving.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: J.J. McCarthy, Kimani Vidal and other tough lineup decisions
content: You didn't draft any of these eight guys to be starters, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't consider it.

title: Jake Paul's new fight wish list: Canelo Alvarez, Ryan Garcia, more
content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his original wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list of opponents with ESPN.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Claxton leads the Nets in fantasy points
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from Nic Claxton, Quentin Grimes, Jusuf Nurkic and Trey Murphy III in the months ahead.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Broncos, Bills among top options in Week 10
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 10, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: What to know ahead of Brazilian Grand Prix sprint weekend
content: Formula 1 has reached round 21 and heads to Interlagos, Brazil for the São Paulo Grand Prix. Everything you need to know for the upcoming sprint weekend.

title: ' Criminal ... drunk!' Bihar dy CM, RJD leader hurl insults over convoy attack - watch
content: Bihar deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha and RJD MLC Ajay Kumar engaged in a heated exchange during the first phase of elections. Sinha alleged his convoy was attacked with cow dung, while Kumar accused Sinha of intimidating voters. Both leaders traded insults, with Sinha blaming Kumar's men for stopping their vehicle and engaging in hooliganism.

title: Pak breaks truce again: Civilian areas shelled, says Kabul; peace talks on
content: Pakistan has reportedly violated the ceasefire by firing into Afghanistan, even as officials meet in Istanbul for renewed talks with Taliban representatives. This comes after a previous agreement for a ceasefire and a monitoring mechanism, following deadly border clashes. The ongoing discussions aim to de-escalate tensions between the neighbours.

title: 'Vote chori proof': Oppn attacks Rakesh Sinha, BJP leaders; RSS ideologue hits back
content: Opposition parties have accused right-wing leaders of voting in multiple states, citing Rakesh Sinha and others as examples of alleged vote theft.  AAP and RJD claim Sinha voted in both Delhi and Bihar elections. Sinha has denied the accusations, saying his voter registration was transferred to Bihar and threatening legal action for defamation.

title: Ford CEO questions Apple’s CarPlay: Warns of overreach; questions Tim Cook
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley expressed strong concerns about Apple's CarPlay Ultra, fearing it encroaches too deeply into vehicle control. He questioned how far Apple's brand should extend into car functions, emphasizing the digital experience as a key differentiator for future vehicles. This follows similar reservations from other automakers and GM's decision to drop both CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: 'For treatment': Gujarat HC grants bail to Asaram; serving life term in 2013 rape case
content: Godman Asaram has been granted six months' bail by the Gujarat high court for medical treatment, mirroring a similar bail granted by the Rajasthan high court. He is serving a life sentence in the Gujarat case for raping a disciple between 2001 and 2006. Asaram also faces a life sentence in a separate rape case in Rajasthan.

title: IND vs AUS: 4th T20I - India take 2-1 series lead with dominant bowling display
content: India secured an unassailable 2-1 series lead against Australia with a commanding 48-run victory in the fourth T20I. A disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Washington Sundar's exceptional death overs, stifled Australia's chase after they were set a target of 168. This win highlights India's composure and adaptability under captain Suryakumar Yadav.

title: Historic! Sheetal Devi earns spot in able-bodied Asia Cup; first para-archer to do so
content: In a historic first, India's armless para-archer Sheetal Devi has been selected for the Indian able-bodied junior team for the Asia Cup Stage 3. The 18-year-old world champion secured third place in national trials, competing alongside over 60 able-bodied archers. This achievement marks a significant step towards her dream of competing with able-bodied athletes.

title: AI layoffs: Goldman Sachs CEO’s take on AI-led job cuts; says will find new jobs but...
content: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon believes AI won't cause widespread job losses, citing historical economic adaptability. While acknowledging disruption and potential white-collar job shifts, he anticipates new roles emerging.  This comes as tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft implement AI, leading to some job cuts, though they also plan future hiring with increased efficiency.

title: 'They welcome infiltrators': Shah takes jibe at Lalu 'chacha' & Rahul at Bihar rally
content: Amit Shah on Thursday took swipe at Rahul Gandhi and Lalu Prasad Yadav, accusing them of supporting infiltrators and warning of a return to 'jungle raj' if the opposition wins. Shah asserted the BJP-NDA's commitment to making Bihar 'infiltrator-free' and highlighted PM Modi's decisive action against terrorism, contrasting it with past Congress governments.

title: What made SRK’s Kabir Khan unforgettable in Chak De! India
content: Shah Rukh Khan's portrayal of Kabir Khan in 'Chak De! India' continues to resonate, showcasing a coach who embraced risks, confronted his past, and masterfully managed ego clashes. Khan's belief in respect and unity in diversity forged a formidable women's hockey team, proving that differences can unite a nation towards victory.

title: ‘Govinda accepted’: IPS officer reveals celebrities did a show for Dawood’s daughter
content: In the 1990s, Bollywood's glamour was overshadowed by underworld influence, with gangsters financing hit films like 'Satya' and 'Company' to enhance their image. Actors and producers lived under constant threat, forced to comply with demands from figures like Dawood Ibrahim, as revealed by former Joint CP Crime Mumbai D Sivanandhan.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: Raina, Dhawan under ED lens: Assets worth Rs 11cr attached; action in betting app case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth over Rs 11 crore belonging to cricketers Suresh Raina and Shikhar Dhawan in a money-laundering probe linked to the betting platform 1xBet. Investigations are examining their endorsement deals and the platform's alleged user fraud and tax evasion. The ED's crackdown targets illegal betting apps nationwide.

title: Watch: Women try to perform puja at disputed mausoleum; clash with police
content: Tension flared in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur as women attempted to offer prayers at a disputed mausoleum on Kartik Purnima. Police intervened, leading to a clash when some women tried to breach barricades. The group eventually performed prayers from a nearby lane, while authorities maintain the site's status is sub judice.

title: '8 planes shot down': Trump updates India-Pak conflict claims; adds new details
content: President Trump claimed he brokered a ceasefire between India and Pakistan by linking it to trade deals, stating they agreed to peace after he threatened tariffs.  He asserted this intervention resolved eight wars during his tenure. However, India has consistently denied any US involvement in the truce.

title: Banality of evil: German nurse kills 10 patients - to reduce workload
content: The court in Aachen called it a crime of “particular severity of guilt,” ensuring he will never walk free again. But what’s truly chilling is not just the scale of his actions — it’s their ordinariness. A man trained since 2007 to heal became, by 2024, an executioner in scrubs, armed not with malice but with indifference.

title: IND vs AUS: 'Smart cricket' - Suryakumar hails India batters after big win vs Australia
content: India secured a 48-run victory over Australia in the fourth T20I, taking an unassailable 2-1 series lead. Skipper Suryakumar Yadav praised the team's smart batting and tactical awareness, while disciplined bowling, particularly from Axar Patel and Washington Sundar, stifled Australia's chase.  The win was attributed to a complete team effort.

title: 'Will run bulldozer': Bihar dy CM after dung thrown at convoy; EC seeks action
content: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha accused RJD supporters of attacking his convoy and hurling stones and cow dung. He reprimanded the Lakhisarai SP, calling him "weak and cowardly" for failing to control the situation and prevent voters from exercising their franchise. The SP stated tensions arose upon Sinha's arrival.

title: IND vs AUS: Arshdeep's catch swings momentum in India's favour - Watch
content: Arshdeep Singh's spectacular catch to dismiss Australian skipper Mitchell Marsh proved a pivotal moment in India's hard-fought victory.  The athletic grab, following a clever slower ball from Shivam Dube, broke a dangerous partnership and reignited India's control. This brilliant fielding display underscored the team's improved standards under Suryakumar Yadav's captaincy, providing a crucial spark in a low-scoring encounter.

title: Women's World Cup: Team India meets President Murmu; gifts jersey
content: The World Cup-winning Indian women's cricket team met President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan, where captain Harmanpreet Kaur presented a signed team jersey. President Murmu congratulated the team on their historic achievement, emphasizing their role as inspiration and a reflection of a united India. The team also met Prime Minister Narendra Modi earlier.

title: Woman’s headless body with severed hands found floating in Noida drain
content: A headless body of a woman was discovered floating in a drain near Sector 82 on Thursday afternoon. A sweeper alerted authorities after noticing the grim discovery around noon. Police have recovered the body and are currently working to ascertain the woman's identity.

title: Ajit Pawar’s son Parth in Rs 300-cr land deal controversy: Sub-registrar suspended
content: In a shocking turn of events, a lucrative Rs 300-crore land transaction in Pune has embroiled Deputy CM Ajit Pawar's son, Parth Pawar, prompting the suspension of a sub-registrar and an extensive investigation by top officials.

title: IND A vs SA A: Jurel scores unbeaten century; rest don't cross 24 runs
content: Dhruv Jurel's unbeaten century was the highlight for India A on Day 1 against South Africa A, rescuing the team from a precarious 59/4. His resilient 132, including a vital partnership with Kuldeep Yadav, propelled India A to 255 all out. Jurel's performance underscores his growing reputation as a dependable middle-order batter.

title: ‘Haq’ movie row: HC junks plea by Shah Bano's daughter against Hashmi-starrer
content: The Madhya Pradesh high court dismissed a plea by Shah Bano Begum's daughter seeking to halt the release of the Bollywood film 'Haq'. The court found no merit in the defamation or rights violation claims, allowing the Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam Dhar starrer to proceed with its theatrical release.

title: ‘New scam’: Bengaluru woman exposes Rapido driver’s fake app; company suspends him
content: A Bengaluru woman has warned commuters about a new Rapido scam where drivers allegedly use fake apps to inflate fares. The driver presented a counterfeit app showing a higher charge, and the ride was not recorded on the genuine Rapido account, preventing complaints. Rapido has since suspended the driver's account.

title: ‘Perfume you can eat’: Mamdani’s 'Rajnigandha' moment just before NYC poll win— Watch
content: New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani's victory was amplified by a viral video of him casually consuming Rajnigandha, a popular Indian mouth freshener. The light-hearted clip, shared widely, resonated with Indian users who flooded social media with memes and celebratory comments, highlighting a cultural connection amidst his historic win.

title: 'New York City’s 111th mayor': Priyanka Chopra congratulates Zohran Mamdani
content: Priyanka Chopra congratulated Zohran Mamdani on Instagram for becoming New York City’s youngest and first Muslim mayor. Son of filmmaker Mira Nair, Zohran made history at 34. Priyanka moved to New York in 2016, married Nick Jonas in 2018, and they now live there with their daughter Malti Marie.

title: KGF Movie actor Harish Rai passes away at 55 after cancer battle
content: Kannada cinema mourns veteran actor Harish Rai, renowned for his impactful roles in 'Om' and the 'KGF' series, who passed away at 55 after a battle with cancer. Rai's career spanned decades, leaving a legacy of intense performances. He had previously spoken about the financial strain of his treatment, while also appreciating the support of 'KGF' star Yash.

title: 'Craziness': Brazilian 'model' reacts after Rahul's Haryana voter-fraud allegation — Watch
content: A Brazilian woman, Larissa, expressed shock after her photograph appeared multiple times in Haryana's voter list, a claim highlighted by Rahul Gandhi alleging widespread voter fraud. Gandhi presented evidence of a single foreign woman's image being used for various Indian names, questioning the integrity of the electoral rolls. The Congress leader asserted that approximately 25 lakh voter records were manipulated.

title: Gold delivers bumper gains as RBI announces SGB 2017-18 Series maturity date
content: Sovereign Gold Bonds are delivering exceptional returns, with one series, SGB 2017-18 Series VI, offering over 300% to investors. Maturing on November 6, 2025, this bond was issued at Rs 2,945 per gram (or Rs 2,895 for digital applicants) and will be redeemed at Rs 12,066 per unit, resulting in significant capital appreciation.

title: Cardiologist with 25 years of experience lists 4 lifestyle factors behind most heart issues
content: Leading cardiologist Dr. Jeremy London reveals four habits that severely damage heart health: smoking/vaping, unhealthy cholesterol, uncontrolled diabetes, and hypertension. These preventable lifestyle choices accelerate artery damage and plaque buildup, significantly increasing the risk of heart disease and stroke. Early detection and intervention are crucial for maintaining a strong cardiovascular system.

title: T20 WC: Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata & Ahmedabad could host matches; final at Modi Stadium
content: The ICC is considering a return to Tier 1 venues for the 2026 T20 World Cup, moving away from the unheralded centers used for the recent Women's World Cup. This strategic shift aims to provide a tournament of the T20 WC's magnitude with the appropriate platform. The tournament does not have an official date as yet.

title: AI to steal your job? Jamie Dimon makes this important statement amid layoff fears
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon anticipates AI will stabilize or grow the bank's workforce, focusing on efficiency gains and redeploying employees. While acknowledging AI's potential to reduce some workloads, he believes it will create new jobs in data and technology, countering widespread job loss concerns.

title: 'Won’t tolerate a Khan as Mumbai mayor': BJP neta’s warning after Mamdani’s NYC win
content: Mumbai BJP's new president, Ameet Satam, pledged to safeguard the city's identity ahead of BMC polls, prioritizing infrastructure, housing, and safety. He vowed to install a BJP mayor, citing concerns over communal division and alleged BMC corruption. Satam highlighted past development projects and promised transparency in civic governance.

title: Shutdown crisis deepens: US losing $15bn each week; 40 airports to be closed
content: America faces its longest government shutdown, crippling the economy with billions in losses weekly. Air travel is severely impacted, with flight reductions and potential chaos due to unpaid air traffic controllers. Essential services are strained, and a political deadlock persists, raising fears of escalating disruptions and permanent economic damage.

title: ‘Roti palatati rehni chahiye’: Lalu calls for ‘young govt’ in Bihar
content: As Bihar's first phase of voting commenced, RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav advocated for a "young government" led by his son Tejashwi Yadav, emphasizing the need for change after two decades. Meanwhile, Rabri Devi sharply criticized Prime Minister Modi and the BJP regarding law and order, accusing party members of violence and abduction.

title: 4 caught dumping garbage roadside in Bengaluru, woman dances in front of CCTV
content: Four individuals were caught on CCTV dumping garbage and then dancing in Mico Layout, Bengaluru. Residents expressed outrage over the disrespectful act. The offenders were identified, fined Rs 1,000 each, and authorities emphasized that civic violations are not a joke, vowing to continue night surveillance.

title: 'Aap bahut glow karte ho': Harleen stumps PM with 'skincare' googly — watch
content: Team India's Harleen Deol lightened the mood during a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi by asking about his skincare routine, leaving everyone in splits. The Prime Minister, smiling, attributed his glow to the blessings of the people. The team was celebrating their recent global title victory.

title: ‘Delivering on promises’: Mamdani names all-women team to lead his NYC transition
content: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani has appointed an all-women team to lead his transition, drawing on experience from previous administrations. Lina Khan, Elana Leopold, Melanie Hartzog, Maria Torres-Springer, and Grace Bonilla are among the key figures tasked with building a City Hall to deliver on Mamdani's campaign promises. This diverse group will help implement his vision for New York City.

title: Who was Anunay Sood? Family, net worth and more of the travel influencer who passed away at 32
content: Dubai-based travel influencer Anunay Sood, known for his stunning drone photography and adventure content, has passed away at 32 in Las Vegas. With a significant following on Instagram and YouTube, Sood was recognized by Forbes India's Top 100 Digital Stars for three consecutive years. The cause of his death remains unknown.

title: When Will Smith narrated segment of the Mahabharat, Bhagavat Gita
content: Hollywood star Will Smith revealed on Jay Shetty's podcast how he found solace in the Mahabharat's tale of Arjuna during a challenging period. Smith highlighted Arjuna's immense struggle against his own kin for kingdom and wife, emphasizing how divine guidance, with God driving his chariot, empowered the warrior against overwhelming odds. This epic continues to inspire.

title: Health risks of drinking too much water you should know
content: Drinking too much water can be dangerous, leading to hyponatraemia, a condition where dangerously low sodium levels cause cells to swell, particularly in the brain. Early signs include fatigue and headaches, escalating to confusion, seizures, and even death. Athletes and those with certain health conditions are at higher risk. Listen to your body's thirst cues to maintain safe hydration levels.

title: Chai, momos & early interviews: How Mamdani spent his 1st day as NYC Mayor-elect
content: New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, had a busy first day, marked by interviews, announcements, and meetings. A highlight was lunch with Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez at Laliguras Bistro, where they enjoyed Indian cuisine. Mamdani, a democratic socialist, secured a significant victory in the mayoral elections, defeating established political figures.

title: A.P. showcases urban transformation plans at Smart City Expo in Barcelona
content: MA&UD Principal Secretary highlightes the State’s integrated approach to urban development that combined transit-oriented development, circular economy principles, net-zero energy targets, electric mobility, advanced utility ducting, and eco-friendly building practices

title: Supreme Court Committee on Road Safety reviews Chevella road accident
content: The Committee directed officials to verify the fitness of TGSRTC buses along those other buses and commercial vehicles, and seize all vehicles found without valid fitness certificates

title: A.P. moving towards 100% real-time governance, says CM Naidu
content: Technology, data integration, and accountability are central to efficient administration, he says, adding that predictive governance is the goal

title: DMK plans to contest in local body polls in Idukki
content: Party eyeing the votes of Tamil origin plantation workers in district. Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi will also be in the fray

title: Only 11,272 foreign nationals have Aadhaar: TMC MP quotes UIDAI reply
content: "If the UIDAI knows the number of foreigners holding Aadhaar cards, why has Amit Shah falsely claimed that there are millions of foreign migrants holding Aadhaar?" the TMC leader asked.

title: Tourism Minister Durgesh hails NRTs’ role in formation of NDA government in Andhra Pradesh
content: Without expecting any gain, they worked tirelessly to ensure the victory of the coalition that believes in democratic principles, he says

title: Judge’s delay in assuming office after transfer from Madras to Kerala High Court sparks concerns among Bar members
content: Justice Nisha Banu, however, says she has applied for earned leave at the Madras High Court in view of her son’s marriage

title: High Court to hear Amol Palekar's plea against pre-censorship of dramas and plays after a decade
content: In September 2017, the High Court had admitted Mr. Palekar's petition against pre-censorship of scripts by the Maharashtra State Performance Scrutiny Board, but it was never taken up for final hearing since then

title: Karnataka HC’s Division Bench tells government to go back to single judge with a plea for lifting stay on GO restricting use of public places
content: A Division Bench of the High Court of Karnataka on Thursday told the State government to go back to the single judge with an application to vacate the interim order of staying the GO issued on October 18, which classifies public gathering of 10 or more individuals in public places, including parks, playgrounds, roads, etc., without prior authorisation, as a criminal offence

title: Tracking turnout trends in Bihar Assembly elections: Infographics
content: An examination of the turnout trends in Bihar for three Assembly elections from 2010 reveals overall increasing turnout, with some laggard constituencies continuing to register low turnouts.

title: Make the most of Centre’s incentives for green hydrogen projects, says NITI Aayog member Saraswat
content: Andhra Pradesh is at an advantage as it stands first in the country in biomass production, he says, calling for use of green hydrogen on a much larger scale in the manufacturing of steel and its products, and fertilizer, and in industries and ports

title: Calcutta High Court asks ECI to file affidavit on PIL questioning SIR on basis of 2002 voters’ list
content: ECI submitted that the writ petition is not maintainable as the same issue is pending before the Supreme Court

title: Resource Mobilisation Committee for higher user charges for govt. services, auction-based digital licensing for excise
content: Low non-tax revenue, especially from user charges and government assets, continues to remain a major challenge in strengthening the State’s fiscal health and sustainable economic growth, according to the Resource Mobilisation Committee report

title: Ramalinga Reddy conducts surprise inspection at Kempegowda Bus Station
content: Passengers had complained to the Minister that the surface in the parking zone was uneven, causing rainwater to stagnate

title: MSME sector contribution during Operation Sindoor was very significant: DRDO Chairman
content: ISRO Chairman V. Narayanan says the first Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) rocket developed by a private consortium led by HAL and L&T would be launched in February, 2026

title: 112 probationary DSPs begin training at Telangana Police Academy
content: True power does not come from the stars on your uniform but from the trust reflected in the eyes of the people, the DGP told the trainee officers

title: Railway Board calls for design tweaks in Vande Bharat sleeper trains
content: Officials have been instructed to implement corrective measures in the current rake and incorporate necessary design improvements in future rakes

title: Jadavpur University introduces month-long online course on India’s plurality
content: The course is a result of a collaboration with the University of East Anglia, focusing on the importance of minority traditions as part of Academic Social Responsibility

title: Bengaluru Rural MP participates in Asian Parliamentary Assembly in Moscow
content: Indian Parliamentary delegation held bilateral discussions with Russian Members of Parliament on matters of mutual interest, aimed at strengthening the long-standing ties between the two nations.

title: India could generate 11 million tonnes of solar waste by 2047: Study
content: Managing this waste would require nearly 300 recycling plants across the country and an investment of around ₹4,200 crore, according to the CEEW study

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹11.14 crore linked to Suresh Raina, Shikhar Dhawan in 1xBet case
content: The former Indian cricketers ‘knowingly entered into endorsement agreements with foreign entities for the promotion of 1xBet through its surrogates,’ the agency said

title: Mamata Banerjee shuns media reports that claimed she personally received SIR enumeration forms from BLO
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has been vehemently opposing the manner in which the SIR exercise is being implemented by the Election Commission of India

title: South African lawmakers show interest in Indian elections, want to visit
content: EC Gyanesh Kumar got a surprise call from the Chairperson of the Electoral Commission of South Africa who extended his best wishes for the Bihar Assembly polls

title: India needs big, world-class banks: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the country needs big and world-class banks, and discussions are on with the Reserve Bank of India and other lenders in this regard

title: T.P. Shaji, who resigned as vice-chairperson of Pattambi municipality, returns to Congress
content: Shaji and around 200 members of his outfit We for Pattambi were welcomed to the Congrees by KPCC president Sunny Joseph at the party’s State headquarters in Thiruvananthapuram. He had left the Congress and formed the party ahead of the 2020 local body polls

title: ISRO wants to transfer 50% of PSLV development to industry consortium, says V. Narayanan
content: ISRO plans to transfer 50% of PSLV development to an industry consortium, aiming to boost India’s space capabilities and foster innovation in the aerospace sector

title: A.P. Grameen Bank aims to increase branches to over 1700
content: The debt-to-credit ratio of the APGB is very impressive and competitive when compared with any other banks in the State, Chairman of the bank said

title: Two killed as illegal bike racing on Peters Road flyover leads to crash in Chennai
content: Two youngsters were engaged in an illegal bike race; crash kills one of them, aged 19, and a 49-year-old motorist who was coming from the opposite direction

title: Assam CIC resigns after RTI query about his brother accused in Zubeen Garg's death case
content: My conscience was telling me that if someone applies for any information about my brother, I should resign from my responsibilities in order to avoid any doubts and suspicions in people's minds, says Assam Chief Information Commissioner Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta

title: Vizag Junior Lit Fest returns this weekend with top authors and storytellers
content: LitLantern’s annual Vizag Junior Lit Fest will be held on November 8 and 9 with 50 sessions a day, outreach events and a line-up of leading writers and storytellers

title: Producers can’t cull out songs I composed for their movies and sell to music labels: Ilaiyaraaja
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar reserves orders on a plea by producers of Ajith Kumar starrer Good Bad Ugly to vacate an interim injunction granted in favour of the composer

title: Congress takes a dig at Centre as Trump repeats ‘India-Pakistan peace’ claim for the ‘58th time’
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh also shared a clip of President Trump’s latest comments from Miami, where he told the America Business Forum that his threat of tariffs forced India and Pakistan to halt hostilities

title: Dreaded woman Maoist with ₹17 lakh bounty surrenders in Chhattisgarh
content: Inspired by government's welfare schemes, and public outreach and dialogue programs under community policing, Kamla Sodi decided to abandon the path of violence, and return to the mainstream, an official said

title: Thiruvananthapuram gets its first inclusive public park for differently abled persons
content: The park, situated in the heart of the city in Kerala capital, has been renamed Captain Lakshmi Inclusive Park

title: Anbumani violating all norms of political decency: PMK founder Ramadoss
content: “I had committed a few mistakes in my political career and this included making Anbumani a Central Minister and the president of the PMK,” he said

title: RJD supporters attacked my convoy in Lakhisarai, alleges Deputy CM Vijay Kumar Sinha
content: Since morning, RJD supporters have been intimidating voters belonging to extremely backward classes. The local SP is a coward, says Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha

title: Amazon Web Services Marketplace expanded in India
content: Amazon announced that its customers in India could buy offerings from India-based software and services companies, in rupees

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea by Abdullah Azam Khan to quash forgery charges to get passport
content: The Allahabad High Court had earlier refused to quash the criminal case, prompting the former MLA to approach the Supreme Court

title: Kerala Industries Minister draws on Malayalam cinema analogies to showcase State’s improved business climate
content: In a Facebook post, Minister compares the troubles faced by entrepreneurs who are protagonists in films Varavelpu (1989) and Mithunam (1993) to Mohanlal’s character in Hridayapoorvam (2025), who runs a successful cloud kitchen business in Kerala

title: Delhi riots case hearing highlights: Organising, participating in protest not a criminal offence, Shadab Ahmed's counsel tells SC
content: The accused strongly contested the Delhi Police’s claim that they had contributed to the delay in the commencement of the trial

title: Tribunal reforms law: Unfair to the court, CJI reacts to a request on behalf of AG for adjournment
content: “We have accommodated him twice… If you want to keep the matter to be listed after November 24, tell us frankly that,” the CJI Gavai, visibly annoyed, asked Additional Solicitor General Aishwarya Bhati

title: SIR: Kerala election officials seek support from residents’ associations for enumeration drive
content: Residents’ associations have been urged to facilitate visit of booth-level officers to households within their area and assist them in meeting residents for enumeration

title: ED summons Anil Ambani to depose on November 14
content: Anil Ambani has been summoned by the ED to appear on November 14 for questioning related to an alleged bank fraud and money laundering case involving ₹7,500 crore in assets

title: RJD, Congress have soft corner for ‘infiltrators’, dislike for Lord Ram because of vote bank, alleges PM Modi
content: In Jungle Raj rule of 1990 to 2005, the development report card was zero, they ruined Bihar, says PM Modi in Bihar

title: Karnataka High Court rejects appeal against stay on government order curbing activities in public spaces
content: According to the GO, any programme or procession held in violation of the government order will be treated as ‘unlawful assembly’ under provisions of the Bharatiya Nyaya Samhita (BNS) Act

title: SIT mulls using portable metal testers to quantify gold content in Sabarimala temple panels
content: Officials say such devices, which use X-ray-based technology for on-the-spot analysis, may help investigators estimate gold content of original alloy encasings without damaging them

title: Union Minister Suresh Gopi again bats for AIIMS in Kerala's Alappuzha
content: Suresh Gopi says that without the foundation stone of an AIIMS being laid in Kerala, he ‘will not go to people seeking votes’

title: OpenAI introduces IndQA benchmark to evaluate AI systems on Indian culture, languages
content: OpenAI noted that it worked with Indian experts across languages and domains in order to develop its new IndQA benchmark

title: Congress accuses NDA of making 'false promises', neglecting development of Bhagalpur, Seemanchal
content: The NITI Aayog report states: 52% of the population of Araria, 50% of the population of Purnia, more than 45% of the population of Kishanganj-Katihar, still struggle with multidimensional poverty, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: ‘20 years, too long!’: Lalu Prasad calls on Bihar's voters to usher in change
content: Lalu Prasad calls for change in Bihar’s leadership as voting began in the 2025 Assembly elections. Voter turnout reached 13.3% by 9 a.m. in this critical contest for State governance

title: Arunachal Sainik School student death: Sister alleges torture by seniors; eight students detained
content: Arunachal Pradesh Police said the students were produced before the Juvenile Justice Board in Pasighat

title: Triangular contest at Anta Assembly seat poses challenge to parties amid caste mobilisation
content: The BJP’s mobilisation of voters with micromanagement on the caste lines is being countered by the Congress with the appeal to cast votes for development, keeping in mind the contributions of its candidate, former Minister Pramod Jain.

title: Bihar polls: With Tejashwi and Tej Pratap in the fray, Rabri Devi sends ‘best wishes to both sons’; casts vote in Patna

title: Ducks, Hawkeyes, trench football: Why you should bet the under on Oregon-Iowa
content: Oregon is 7-1 overall and 4-1 in the Big Ten, but now comes a trip to Iowa . the Hawkeyes sit at 6-2 and 4--1 in conference play, just outside the top 25 at no. 26 in the AP poll .

title: Be Nitish, Tejashwi or PK for a minute — can you win Bihar?
content: our interactive election simulator lets you run a five-step campaign of your own . in each round, you choose realistic strategies — from coalition math to messaging, crisis management, ground game and the final push . each path reshapes your approval, party cohesion and the “social fabric” score .

title: The Bilas Index: Jay Bilas picks his top 68 teams this season
content: the Bilas Index is the most powerful and consequential instrument of basketball wisdom and judgment known to humankind . it serves as much more than a guide or a road map to this men's college basketball season . the Bilastrator's immense and powerful brain is superior in processing basketball performance, potential and ability .

title: Week 11 preview: Five freshmen who have impressed, how the Aggies got better in 2025 and more
content: Paul Finebaum says Texas A&M should be no. 2 ahead of Indiana . the first college football playoff rankings reveal the big 12 . it adds up to make Saturday's matchup the most consequential in college football .

title: Women's college volleyball Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: the women's college volleyball season is in the stretch run . there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the top eight teams in each region serve as first- and second-round hosts .

title: NHL prospect pipeline rankings: Sharks, Islanders, then ...?
content: a player who is under 23, with less than 50 NHL games played, is eligible for this list . the rankings are done by assigning a value to each of the prospects based on their NHL projection and taking the cumulative value of each team's prospects . this is the tie to the pipeline with the higher quality prospects, Counting down from no. 32 all the way to no. 1 .

title: Talking points: Flawless Bayern, Slot's switch, VdV's worldie, more
content: arsenal beat paris saint-Germain 3-0 in the champions league on saturday . they have had statement wins, end-to-end draws and some shock losses . sportsmail's Beth Lindop, Sam Tighe, Rob Dawson and Gab Marcotti offer their thoughts on matchday 4 .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: ⬇ Bottom 10: Georgia Tech latest to be wrecked
content: we love college football most of all for its dedication to traditions . "November Rain," guns N' Roses Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, is located in the very empty wardrobe box . a season of Auburn football penning more drama than a "General Host" season .

title: Week 11 Anger Index: The case for outrage over BYU's and Miami's CFP rankings
content: the college football playoff committee has released its first top 25 ranking of the year . it's the sport's version of Walmart opening its doors at midnight on black Friday . this year, the committee has said it is considering a new "record strength" metric .

title: 'I've got to get my act together': Pete Carroll pushing to get Raiders on track
content: PETE CARROLL KNEW, 74, is the only one to have coached in a super bowl and national title game . they have combined for 741 wins (52 in the postseason), 20 conference championship game appearances, nine Super Bowl appearances and five Super Bowl wins . the 74-year-old has the résumé that stacks up wit .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Where do things stand following the first committee ranking?
content: the lone ACC team in the bracket if it were released today would be no. 14 Virginia . the ACC is already playing from behind, and it's only the first ranking of the season . teams with Would be in status below are in this week's bracket based on the committee ranking .
